intro: Pancratium australe, commonly known as the Australian torch lily, is a striking flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and showy, orange-red flowers. The plant produces large, bell-shaped blooms that are often clustered at the top of the stem. Its leaves are long, narrow, and grass-like, typically emerging from the base. Pancratium australe is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal regions and sandy soils.
